comment:
Extracted Variables:
- \( x_{\text{molars}} \): Number of molars to be filled
- \( x_{\text{canines}} \): Number of canines to be filled
- \( \text{resin\_molars} = 20 \): Units of resin required to fill one molar
- \( \text{resin\_canines} = 15 \): Units of resin required to fill one canine
- \( \text{pain\_killer\_molars} = 3 \): Units of pain killer required to fill one molar
- \( \text{pain\_killer\_canines} = 2.3 \): Units of pain killer required to fill one canine

Constraints:
1. \( 20x_{\text{molars}} + 15x_{\text{canines}} \leq 3000 \): Total units of resin used should not exceed 3000
2. \( x_{\text{canines}} \geq 0.6(x_{\text{molars}} + x_{\text{canines}}) \): At least 60% of cavities filled must be in canines
3. \( x_{\text{molars}} \geq 45 \): At least 45 molars must be filled

Objective:
Minimize \( 3x_{\text{molars}} + 2.3x_{\text{canines}} \): Minimize the amount of pain killer needed
